intro: Senecio miguelii, commonly known as Miguel's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually gray-green and have a rough texture, while its flowers range from yellow to orange in color. Senecio miguelii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
